DOCNAME: KOCAROVA v. "THE FORMER YUGOSLAV REPUBLIC OF MACEDONIA"
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a citizen of the former GPE who was born in DATE and lives in GPE . She is represented before the ORG by PERSON and PERSON , lawyers practising in Stip , in the former GPE .

In or DATE Mr P.S. , the applicant ’s brother , instituted civil proceedings before the then ORG ( PERSON Суд Струмица ) for termination of a care agreement ( “ the agreement ” ) that he had concluded on DATE with Mr G.P. Mr DATE claimed that Mr ORG had not provided him with a regular financial assistance , as specified by the agreement . Under the agreement , PERSON was authorised to collect the rent obtained from Mr PERSON ’s movable and immovable property , which would then have been transferred in his possession after Mr ORG death .

On DATE ORG granted Mr DATE ’s application and terminated the DATE agreement . After examining considerable evidence , namely several witnesses , the parties to the proceedings and the correspondence between them , the court found that the agreement had not been carried out , as Mr P.S. had sufficient financial means and it had been he who had actually given money to Mr G.P , contrary to what had been agreed .
On DATE the then ORG upheld PERSON appeal and quashed the lower court ’s decision , as it had not properly established whether the latter had fulfilled his obligations under the agreement .

On DATE ORG upheld Mr P.S. ’s claim and terminated the agreement . After examining other witnesses and additional correspondence between the parties , the court held that PERSON had not provided Mr PERSON with a regular financial maintenance as agreed .

On DATE ORG upheld PERSON appeal and remitted the case for a fresh consideration . It held that the trial court had not been established by law , as the case had been tried by a single judge instead of by a panel of judges .

On an unspecified date in DATE Mr P.S. passed away . The latter ’s heirs , including the applicant , instituted inheritance proceedings concerning his property . By a court decision of DATE , they were instructed to institute separate civil proceedings to determine the ownership of the property at stake and to take over Mr PERSON ’s case . It appears that this decision was subsequently overturned by ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE , by which the inheritance proceedings had been stayed . Mr ORG heirs , including the applicant , took over the case and joined the proceedings complained of .

On DATE ORG upheld Mr P.S. ’s claim and terminated the agreement . The court held that the number of contacts between Mr G.P. and Mr P.S. had diminished over time and stopped DATE before the latter ’s death ; that PERSON had not given the DATE financial support to Mr P.S. as agreed and that it was the applicant who had started caring for him instead . It established that the applicant , despite prior misunderstandings with her late brother , had endeavoured to improve their personal relationships . The court also found that Mr DATE , as recognition of the applicant ’s efforts , had vowed that after his death all his property should be transferred in her possession .

On DATE ORG dismissed PERSON appeal and upheld the lower court ’s decision . It overturned it in part concerning the trial costs entitling the applicant and the other heirs of Mr DATE to collect the reduced award .
On DATE Mr ORG submitted to ORG an appeal on points of law ( ревизија ) .
On DATE the applicant states that she was provided with a copy of it .

On DATE PERSON lodged with FAC a request for re - opening of the proceedings ( предлог за повторување на постaпката ) . He claimed that the courts had wrongly accepted the applicant and the others as claimants in the instant proceedings , as there had been no court decision ascertaining them as Mr PERSON ’s heirs . He further claimed that the courts had wrongly considered Mr PERSON as a party to the proceedings after his death . He also referred to another care agreement of DATE concluded between the same parties and to ORG decision of DATE , adopted in different set of proceedings , by which he had been allegedly recognised as an owner of the property on the basis of the DATE agreement .

On DATE ORG Instance dismissed PERSON request for re - opening of the proceedings . It found that ORG decision of DATE had been made in administrative contentious proceedings ( управен спор ) concerning administrative decisions for payment of personal income tax related to Mr ORG property . ORG had referred in this decision to ORG decision of DATE by which the inheritance proceedings concerning Mr PERSON ’s property had been stayed , as it had already been transferred into Mr ORG ownership by virtue of the DATE and DATE agreements . The court held that the facts , which ORG had referred to in its decision of DATE , could not be regarded as a new evidence that had been unknown to PERSON during the proceedings and that consequently , they could not be considered as a proper ground for re - opening of the proceedings . The court used the same reasoning to dismiss the other arguments for re - opening of the proceedings .

On DATE ORG upheld PERSON appeal and overturned the lower court ’s decision . It granted his request for re - opening of the proceedings and quashed the decisions of CARDINAL DATE and DATE , respectively , by which the DATE agreement had been terminated . It held that the evidence provided by PERSON had been new and that he could not have used it in the previous proceedings .

On DATE the public prosecutor lodged with ORG a request for the protection of legality ( барање за заштита на законитоста ) against the appeal court ’s decision , as it had been incoherent and had lacked sufficient reasoning as to how the newly discovered evidence could have been beneficial for the party concerned if admitted in the previous proceedings .
On DATE ORG upheld the public prosecutor ’s request and quashed ORG decision of DATE .
On DATE the ORG dismissed PERSON appeal against the court ’s decision of DATE . It reiterated the lower court ’s reasoning to dismiss PERSON request for re - opening of the proceedings .

On DATE ORG rejected ( отфрла ) the appeal on points of law of DATE submitted against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE . The court considered it as inadmissible as the value of the dispute fell below the statutory threshold . It accordingly rejected Mr ORG ’s appeal on points of law filed against ORG decision of CARDINAL DATE .
